How to Run Learning Simulator¶

If you use the executable file learningsimulator.exe on Windows (downloadable from the Download section on the Learning Simulator Project website), this will launch the Learning Simulator graphical user interface (GUI) only. It is not possible to run a script from the command line with this executable.

If you use IDLE, open the file lesim.py and run it to launch the GUI.

If you have a standard Python environment (that fulfils the Python Dependencies), use the below commands.

Learning Simulator can run a simulation script either from the command line or using the GUI. Pass lesim.py to the python command with the relevant arguments. To see the available arguments, use:

> python lesim.py help

Running a script from the command line¶

To run a script from the command line, use the argument run to lesim:

> python lesim.py run file1 [file2, file3, ...]

Running a script using the GUI¶

To launch the GUI, use the argument gui to lesim:

> python lesim.py gui

or, for short:

> python lesim.py

Once the GUI is launched, run a script by opening it (with File > Open), write a script, or paste an existing script into the script window, then run it (with Run > Simulate and Plot, or the Simulate and Plot button).
